name: baby angel: medium skin tone

bn:00097091a: Belonging to, proceeding from, or resembling an angel.
Belonging to, or proceeding from, angels; resembling, characteristic of, or partaking of the nature of, an angel.

bn:13609523v: To transport to the abode of God, the gods, or the blessed

bn:00084343v: To depart, to cease, to come to an end.
To die; to cease to live.
To become indifferent; to cease to be subject.
Pass from physical life and lose all bodily attributes and functions necessary to sustain life

bn:00088378v: Travel through the air; be airborne
To cause to travel through the air.
To cause to fly : to transport via air or the like.
To move autonomously through the air, without any part of the object or object's enclosure touching anything attached to the ground.

bn:00007630n: A very young human being, from birth to somewhere between six months and two years of age, needing almost constant care and/or attention.
A very young human being, from birth to a year old.
Babies are the very young offspring of a human or other mammal.
An infant is the very young offspring of a human or animal.
A young child in the first years of life.
A very young human, particularly from birth to a couple of years old or until walking is fully mastered.
A baby or infant; a very young human or animal.
A very young child (birth to 1 year) who has not yet begun to walk or talk

bn:00032600n: Part of the body at the front of the head
The face is a central organ of sense and is also very central in the expression of emotion among humans and among numerous other species.
Faces are the central sense organ complexes, for those animals that have one, normally on the ventral surface of the head.
The front of the human head from the forehead to the chin and ear to ear
The front part of the head, featuring the eyes, nose, and mouth and the surrounding area.

bn:00032763n: A story about fairies; told to amuse children
Fairy tales are a type of story which typically features fantasy characters, such as fairies, goblins, elves, trolls, dwarves, giants, mermaids, or gnomes, and usually magic or enchantments. tale

A fairy tale is a type of short story that typically features European folkloric fantasy characters, such as dwarves, elves, fairies, giants, gnomes, goblins, mermaids, trolls, or witches, and usually magic or enchantments.
A folktale featuring fairies or similar fantasy characters.
A fictional story that usually features folkloric characters (such as fairies, goblins, elves, trolls, witches, giants, and talking animals) and enchantments
Fictional story featuring folkloric fantasy characters

bn:00007184n: A halo is a ring of light that surrounds a person in art.
Also known as nimbus, a ring of light surrounding a person in a piece of art
Glory is used to denote the manifestation of God's presence in the Christian religious tradition.
A solid disk of light or gold.
An emanation of light supposed to proceed from beings of peculiar sanctity. It is represented in art by rays of gold, or the like, proceeding from the head or body, or by a disk, or a mere line.
Nimbus, a luminous disc, often of gold, around or over the heads of saints, etc., in religious paintings.
Manifestation of God's presence in the Christian religious tradition
An aureola or aureole is the radiance of luminous cloud which, in paintings of sacred personages, surrounds the whole figure.
An indication of radiant light drawn around the head of a saint
In Judeo-Christian religious tradition, the manifestation of God's presence
A circle of light or halo around the head of a deity or a saint.
Circle of light or halo around the head of a deity.
Radiance of luminous cloud that surrounds the figure in a painting of a sacred personage.
A circle of light; a halo.

bn:02334287n: A representation of a naked, often winged, child, especially a cherub or a cupid in Renaissance or Baroque art.
Figure in a work of art depicted as a chubby male child, usually nude and sometimes winged
A putto is a figure in a work of art depicted as a chubby male child, usually nude and sometimes winged.
Representation of a naked, winged child.
A representation, in a work of art (especially Renaissance or Baroque), of a small, naked, winged child; a cherub.

bn:00029734n: Heaven, the heavens or seven heavens, is a common religious, cosmological, or transcendent place where heavenly beings such as gods, angels, jinn, saints, or venerated ancestors originate, are enthroned, or live.
Any place of complete bliss and delight and peace
A place of complete bliss, delight, and peace; paradise.

Heaven may refer to the physical heavens, the sky, the seemingly endless expanse of the universe beyond, or to otherworldly realms, often in an "afterlife plane" of existence, attested to in various religions or spiritual philosophies.

bn:00004063n: Supernatural being or spirit in certain religions and mythologies
An angel is a supernatural being or spirit found in various religions and mythologies.
Angels are divine messengers or transcendental beings found in many religions.
A divine and supernatural messenger from a deity, or other divine entity.

bn:01669238n: The literary genre generally dealing with themes of magic and fictive medieval technology.
Fantasy refers to constructs of the imagination; in storytelling Fantasy generally refers to a genre that uses magic and other supernatural forms as a primary element of plot, theme, and/or setting.
Fantasy is a genre of fiction that commonly uses magic and other supernatural phenomena as a primary plot element, theme, or setting.
A genre of literature and art that uses magic and other supernatural forms as a primary element of plot and theme. The storyline is often set in a fictional, historically oriented setting.
